name: Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
review: A timeless tragedy of young love, Romeo and Juliet tells the story of two star-crossed lovers whose families' feuds lead to their untimely demise.

name: Hamlet
author: William Shakespeare
review: One of Shakespeare's most famous plays, Hamlet explores themes of revenge, madness, and the complexities of the human condition.

name: Macbeth
author: William Shakespeare
review: A dark and powerful tragedy, Macbeth follows the ambitious rise and tragic fall of a Scottish general consumed by his lust for power.

name: A Midsummer Night's Dream
author: William Shakespeare
review: A whimsical comedy set in an enchanted forest, A Midsummer Night's Dream weaves together the stories of lovers, fairies, and amateur actors.

name: The Tempest
author: William Shakespeare
review: A tale of shipwrecks, sorcery, and redemption, The Tempest explores themes of forgiveness and the power of art.

name: Othello
author: William Shakespeare
review: Othello is a tragedy that explores themes of jealousy, race, and manipulation, showcasing the destructive power of suspicion.
